rev.diff:
Line 33: Line 33:
For 1 February 2008's Twenty20 match between Australia and India, 84,041<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cricinfo.com/ausvind/content/story/334462.html|title=India crash to nine-wicket defeat|publisher=Cricinfo.com|date=February 1, 2008}}</ref> people attended the match at the [[Melbourne Cricket Ground]] involving the Twenty20 World Champions against the ODI World Champions.
For 1 February 2008's Twenty20 match between Australia and India, 84,041<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cricinfo.com/ausvind/content/story/334462.html|title=India crash to nine-wicket defeat|publisher=Cricinfo.com|date=February 1, 2008}}</ref> people attended the match at the [[Melbourne Cricket Ground]] involving the Twenty20 World Champions against the ODI World Champions.
â   â
[[File:DLF IPL logo.png|thumb|200 px|right|The logo of the [[Indian Premier League]]]]
 
Twenty20 attracted billions of fans to the game through the [[Indian Premier League]].The first [[Indian Premier League]] which was staged in India in [[2008 Indian Premier League|2008]] changed the face of the game.The league involved over hundreds of players contracted and over billion dollars investment.It was won by [[Rajasthan Royals]] with the [[Chennai Super Kings]] finishing as runners-up.The second edition was staged in [[2009 Indian Premier League|South Africa]] which was won by [[Deccan Chargers]] beating the [[Royal Challengers]] in the final.The third edition was played in [[2010 Indian Premier League|India]] despite the many challenges and contraversies occured.The league was won by the [[Chennai Super Kings]] with [[Mumbai Indians]] finishing as the runners-up.
Twenty20 attracted billions of fans to the game through the [[Indian Premier League]].The first [[Indian Premier League]] which was staged in India in [[2008 Indian Premier League|2008]] changed the face of the game.The league involved over hundreds of players contracted and over billion dollars investment.It was won by [[Rajasthan Royals]] with the [[Chennai Super Kings]] finishing as runners-up.The second edition was staged in [[2009 Indian Premier League|South Africa]] which was won by [[Deccan Chargers]] beating the [[Royal Challengers]] in the final.The third edition was played in [[2010 Indian Premier League|India]] despite the many challenges and contraversies occured.The league was won by the [[Chennai Super Kings]] with [[Mumbai Indians]] finishing as the runners-up.

This is a list of the main Twenty20 domestic competitions in each cricketing country.
